column3: May 21 United Launch Alliance
column4: a 50-50 joint venture of Lockheed Martin Corp and Boeing Co

column2: MOVES-Citigroup picks Tweedie to head UK corporate banking LONDON
column3: May 21 (IFR) - Citigroup has promoted Mark Tweedie to the position of head of corporate banking for the UK. He will take up the job on July 1 and have coverage responsibility for several key accounts in the country
column4: the bank said.

column2: UPDATE 1-Reynolds American close to getting FTC approval for Lorillard deal - WSJ May 21 Camel cigarette brand owner Reynolds American Inc's planned acquisition of smaller rival Lorillard Inc is expected to receive U.S. antitrust clearance as soon as next week
column3: the Wall Street Journal said. (http://on.wsj.com/1Hxtr4g)

column2: INSIGHT-Small food makers on fast path to US store shelves
column3: threatening big producersSmall food makers on fast path to U.S. store shelves
column4: threatening big producers NEW YORK Small U.S. food manufacturers once toiled for decades to develop a critical mass of fans for their products. Now
column5: an increasing number of privately-held players are going from garage to grocery store in fewer than five years thanks to an erosion of barriers to entry within the food industry.  Small food makers on fast path to U.S. store shelves

column2: BNY Mellon to pay $180 mln to settle foreign exchange lawsuit May 21 Bank of New York Mellon Corp will pay $180 million to settle a foreign exchange-related putative class action lawsuit
column3: the bank said in a regulatory filing on Thursday.

column2: Wells Fargo to change U.S. money market funds NEW YORK
column3: May 21 Wells Fargo's fund unit said on Thursday it will make changes to its U.S. money market funds
column4: marking the latest fund operator to adopt moves to comply with regulatory changes for the $2.6 trillion industry.
